application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

We are the global retail ads marketing team, and we own all business driving and growth, thought leadership and product marketing programs for Google's ads products targeting the retailer and brand manufacturer segment. Our programs touch both small and large retailer advertisers, and we often work with other product areas across Google to market entire solutions relevant to retailers (across Google Cloud Platform, Google Marketing Platform, Google Pay, AR/VR and Shopping Ads).

As a growth marketer you will set strategy for acquiring, onboarding and retaining small business retail advertisers. You will create content, and full funnel engagement programs, working closely with other marketers to identify opportunities along the customer lifecycle to drive product adoptions or reduce advertiser churn. Your goal will be to increase retailers’ spend and product adoptions, while positioning Google as the best partner for growth. You’ll be responsible for reporting and quant analysis of your programs.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in B2B tech, brand or retailer marketing, strategy consulting, and/or related field.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with growth and customer lifecycle marketing: product adoption, optimization and retention
  • Deep understanding of Google's products and the retail industry
  • Attention to detail, ability to build tracking and measurement capabilities into all projects you execute
  • Global mindset and ability to think across disciplines, industries, cultures and scenarios
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills
responsibilities:
• Use quantitative methods, models and research to help Google better understand small business retail advertisers’ behavior to inform strategy of all marketing programs
  • Define and execute the growth strategy, including scaled communications, competitive analysis, and product adoption and retention
  • Develop messaging, collateral, events, and business strategies aimed at growing advertisers, increasing our engagement with them and measuring the efficacy of such programs
  • Determine return on investment for projects
  • Collaborate with marketing and product teams to design and launch experiments based on data-driven and user-driven insights
title: Growth Marketing Manager, Retail Ads
